Open the checkout in a new popup centered over the parent window.

locale object contains text used for all thirdweb components

it allows you to change the language used in UI components or override the texts used in the UI

React SDK comes out of the box with Spanish and Japanese locale functions, but you can add support for any language you want just by passing an object with the required strings

content.text:
## Using Built-in Locales

### Using the Spanish locale

summary.text: if you want to provide your own wallet connection logic.

Wallets supported by the dApp

If no wallets are provided, the default wallets will be used which is equivalent to the following:

```tsx
[
 metamaskWallet(),
 coinbaseWallet(),
 walletConnect(),
 trustWallet(),
 rainbowWallet(),
 zerionWallet(),
 phantomWallet(),
]
```

Set the theme for all thirdweb components

By default it is set to "dark".

theme can be set to either "dark" or "light" or a custom theme object.

You can also import
to use the default themes as base and overrides parts of it.

The address of the NFT contract.
The title of the NFT in the collection.
Arbitrary properties (i.e. traits) describing the NFT.

The ID of the token in the collection that was claimed.
For ERC-721 collections, this ID is unique for each claim.
For ERC-1155 collections, this ID is identical for all buyers of this NFT token.
The blockchain explorer URL for the claim transaction.
The transaction hash for the claim transaction.

The blockchain explorer URL for the transfer transaction.
This hash is undefined if the claim directly sent the token to the buyer's wallet.

The transaction hash for the transfer transaction.
This hash is undefined if the claim directly sent the token to the buyer's wallet.

Specify how the connection to metamask app should be established if the user is on a mobile device

There are two options: "walletconnect" and "browser"

1. "walletconnect" - User will be redirected to MetaMask app and upon successful connection, user can return back to the web page.
2. "browser" - User will be redirected to MetaMask app and the web page will be opened in MetaMask browser.

Default is

summary.text: Override how the chain button is rendered in the Modal
Specify sections of chains to be displayed in the Network Selector Modal

content.text: To display "Polygon", "Avalanche" chains under "Recently used" section and "Ethereum", "Arbitrum" chains under "Popular" section, you can set the prop with the following value

```ts
import { Polygon, Avalanche, Ethereum, Arbitrum } from "@thirdweb-dev/chains";

const sections = [
 { label: 'Recently used', chains: [Polygon, Avalanche] },
 { label: 'Popular', chains: [Ethereum, Arbitrum] },
]
```

function for non native coins.

should be human readable. So "1.2" represents "1.2" ETH or "1.2" USDC depending on the

A component that allows the user to connect their wallet.

it renders the same UI as the [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/v4/components/ConnectWallet) component's modal - but directly on the page instead of being in a modal.

It only renders UI if either one of the following conditions are met:
- wallet is not connected
- wallet is connected but the user is not signed in and
is required ( loginOptional is not set to false )

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/v4/useShowConnectEmbed) hook internally to determine if it should be rendered or not. You can also use this hook to determine if you should render something else instead of

Component that renders any asset stored on IPFS (or anywhere else), given the IPFS URI / URL.

Under the hood, the asset is fetched from IPFS through the thirdweb IPFS gateway (or just
a regular fetch if the

is not an IPFS URI).
The [mime type](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types) of the
asset is determined and the appropriate component is rendered on the UI.

For example, if the URI points to an image, the
tag will be used. If it is a video, the

tag will be used, etc.
The component currently supports:

- Images
- Videos
- Audio files
- 3D Models
- SVGs (for [on-chain NFTs](https://blog.thirdweb.com/guides/how-to-create-on-chain-nfts-with-thirdweb/))
-
- If none of these are appropriate, the fallback is a link to the asset

The default size of rendered media is 300px x 300px, but this can be changed using the
to upload any file to IPFS and get the IPFS URI.

The props for the component

### src (required)

The [src](https://www.w3schools.com/tags/att_img_src.asp) attribute specifies the URL of the media.

This can be an IPFS URI, or any URL that points to media (e.g. HTTP URL, etc.).

### alt (recommended)

The [alt](https://www.w3schools.com/tags/att_img_alt.asp) attributes provides alternative
information for the media, if a user for some reason cannot view it
(due to slow connection, an error in the

attribute, or if the user is visually impaired).

The default value is

### poster (optional)

The [poster](https://www.w3schools.com/tags/att_video_poster.asp) is the image
that is shown before the video is played.

The default value is the first frame of the video.

If the
is not a video, this prop is ignored.

### controls (optional)

Show the media controls (play, pause, etc.) for the media, where applicable.

The default value is

### height (optional)

The default value is

### width (optional)

The width of the rendered media.

The default value is

### requireInteraction (optional)

content.text: You can wrap your application with the provider as follows:

summary.text:
The props for the component.

### activeChain (optional)
The activeChain prop determines which chain you want your app to be operating on.

There are 1000+ chains available in the
package. Import the chain you want and pass it to the

prop.

You can override the imported object or pass a custom chain object with required properties.

### supportedChains (optional)
An array of chains supported by your app.
There are 1000+ chains available in the
package. You can import the chain you want and pass it to the

prop in an array.

If not provided, it will default to the default supported chains supported by the thirdweb SDK.

### clientId (optional)
The clientId prop is required to use the thirdweb infrastructure services with the SDK.

You can get a client ID by creating an API key on [thirdweb dashboard](https://thirdweb.com/dashboard/settings/api-keys)

### supportedWallets (optional)
Wallets supported by the dApp

If no wallets are provided, the default wallets will be used which is equivalent to the following:

```tsx
[
 metamaskWallet(),
 coinbaseWallet(),
 walletConnect(),
 trustWallet(),
 rainbowWallet(),
 zerionWallet(),
 phantomWallet(),
]
```

### theme (optional)
Set the theme for all thirdweb components

By default it is set to "dark".

theme can be set to either "dark" or "light" or a custom theme object.

You can also import
to use the default themes as base and overrides parts of it.

### locale (optional)
locale object contains text used for all thirdweb components

it allows you to change the language used in UI components or override the texts used in the UI

React SDK comes out of the box with Spanish and Japanese locale functions, but you can add support for any language you want just by passing an object with the required strings

#### Using Built-in Locales

##### Using the Spanish locale

### dAppMeta (optional)
Metadata to pass to wallet connect and walletlink wallet connect. (Used to show *which* dApp is being connected to in mobile wallets that support it)
Defaults to just the name being passed as

.

### autoConnect (optional)
When the user has connected their wallet to your site, this flag determines whether or not you want to automatically connect to the last connected wallet when user visits your site again in the future.
Defaults to

.

### sdkOptions (optional)
Override any of the default values for the SDK. Gas settings, gasless transactions, RPC configuration, and more.

### authConfig (optional)
The configuration object for setting up [Auth](https://portal.thirdweb.com/wallets/auth); allowing users to sign in with their wallet.
It takes an object with the following properties:
-
- The backend URL of the authentication endpoints. For example, if your endpoints are at
, etc. then this should be set to

- The frontend domain used to generate the login payload. This domain should match the domain used on your auth backend.
-
- Secure storage to use when working with JWT tokens. By default auth uses cookies so no need to set this unless you want to specifically use JWT tokens

### signer (optional)
Use a signer instead of

if you want to provide your own wallet connection logic.

### storageInterface
Override the default [Storage](/storage) interface used by the SDK.

Allows you to create an instance of
with your own customized config, and pass it to the SDK. This requires the

package to be installed.

[Learn more about storage](https://portal.thirdweb.com/infrastructure/storage/overview)

### queryClient (optional)
If you are using [React Query](https://react-query.tanstack.com/) and have your own

,
you can pass it as the
prop to use this client instead of the SDK's default client.

content.text:
Function to set the Modal config

The function takes an object with the following properties

### title
Title of the Modal

### theme
theme to use in Modal

By default it is set to "dark" if

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/v4/ThirdwebProvider) then that theme will be used by default

theme can be set to either
or a custom theme object. You can also import
to use the default themes as base and overrides parts of it.

### modalSize
Set the size of the modal -

on desktop

Modal size is always

on mobile

By default it is

for desktop.

### termsOfServiceUrl
URL of the "terms of service" page

If provided, Modal will show a Terms of Service message at the bottom with below link

### privacyPolicyUrl
URL of the "privacy policy" page

If provided, Modal will show a Privacy Policy message at the bottom with below link

### welcomeScreen
Customize the welcome screen. This is only applicable when

is set to "wide".
On "wide" Modal size, a welcome screen is shown on the right side of the modal.

This screen can be customized in two ways

#### 1. Customize Metadata and Image

### titleIconUrl
Replace the thirdweb icon next to modalTitle and set your own iconUrl

### auth
The object contains the following properties to customize the authentication
-
- specify whether signing in is optional or not. By default it is

- Callback to be called after user signs in with their wallet
-

- Callback to be called after user signs out

### onConnect
Callback to be called on successful connection of wallet
Note that this does not include the sign in, If you want to call a callback after user connects AND signs in with their wallet, use

Smart Wallet configuration options

#### factoryAddress (required)
The address of the Smart Wallet Factory contract. Must be of type

.

#### gasless (required)
Whether to turn on or off gasless transactions.

- If set to

, all gas fees will be paid by a paymaster.
- If set to

, all gas fees will be paid by the Smart Wallet itself (needs to be funded).

Must be a

.

#### factoryInfo (optional)
Customize how the Smart Wallet Factory contract is interacted with. If not provided, the default functions will be used.

Must be a

. The object can contain the following properties:

-

- a function that returns the transaction object to create a new Smart Wallet.
-

- a function that returns the address of the Smart Wallet contract given the owner address.
-
- optional ABI. If not provided, the ABI will be auto-resolved.

#### accountInfo (optional)
Customize how the Smart Wallet Account contract is interacted with. If not provided, the default functions will be used.

Must be a

. The object can contain the following properties:

-

- a function that returns the transaction object to execute an arbitrary transaction.
-

- a function that returns the current nonce of the account.
-
- optional ABI. If not provided, the ABI will be auto-resolved.

#### bundlerUrl (optional)
Your own bundler URL to send user operations to. Uses thirdweb's bundler by default.

Must be a

.

#### paymasterUrl (optional)
Your own paymaster URL to send user operations to for gasless transactions. Uses thirdweb's paymaster by default.

Must be a

.

#### entryPointAddress
The entrypoint contract address. Uses v0.6 by default.

Must be a

.

#### deployOnSign
Whether to deploy the smart wallet when the user signs a message. Defaults to true.

Must be a

It ensures the following criteria before attempting to call the contract function:

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/v4/components/ConnectWallet) component instead.

2. The connected wallet is on the correct network as specified in the [

prop. if it is not, it renders a "switch network" button instead.

If the action you are performing is async, make sure to return a
from the action function so that the SDK knows when the action is complete. This can be done by either using async/await or by returning a

readme.text:
thirdweb React SDK

Ultimate collection of React hooks for your web3 apps



## Installation The easiest way to get started with the React SDK is to use the CLI:
Alternatively, you can install the SDK into your existing project using npm or yarn:
## Getting Started Our SDK uses a [Provider Pattern](https://flexiple.com/react/provider-pattern-with-react-context-api/); meaning any component within the

will have access to the SDK. If you use the CLI to initialize your project, this is already set up for you. Let's take a look at a typical setup:
### Configure the
Specify the network your smart contracts are deployed to in the
prop and wrap your application like so:

Below are examples of where to set this up in your application:

Create React App Next.js Vite


### Connect to a User's Wallet Now the provider is set up, we can use all of the hooks and UI components available in the SDK, such as the [ConnectWallet](https://portal.thirdweb.com/ui-components/connectwalletbutton) component. Once the user has connected their wallet, all the calls we make to interact with contracts using the SDK will be on behalf of the user.

component handles everything for us, including switching networks, accounts, displaying balances and more.

We can then get the connected address using the

hook anywhere in the app.
### Interact With Contracts Connect to your smart contract using the [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/sdk/interacting-with-contracts/custom-contracts/using-contracts) to read data and write transactions to the contract.

You pass the

to these hooks as the first parameter and the name of the function (or view/mapping, etc.) on your smart contract as the second parameter. If your function requires parameters, you can pass them as additional arguments.

For example, we can read the

### Using Extensions Each [extension](https://portal.thirdweb.com/extensions) you implement in your smart contract unlocks new functionality in the SDK. These hooks make it easy to interact with your smart contracts by implementing the complex logic for you under the hood. For example, if your smart contract implements [ERC721Supply](https://portal.thirdweb.com/solidity/extensions/erc721supply), you unlock the ability to [view all NFTs](https://portal.thirdweb.com/sdk/interacting-with-contracts/erc721supply#get-all-minted-nfts) on that contract using the SDK; which fetches all of your NFT metadata and the current owner of each NFT in parallel. In the React SDK, that is available using
If we want to mint an NFT and our contract implements [ERC721Mintable](https://portal.thirdweb.com/solidity/extensions/erc721mintable), we can use the [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/sdk/interacting-with-contracts/erc721mintable) hook to mint an NFT from the connected wallet; handling all of the logic of uploading and pinning the metadata to IPFS for us behind the scenes.

.

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usesdk)                           | Access the instance of the thirdweb SDK created by the ThirdwebProvider.   |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usecontract)                 | Use this resolve a contract address to a smart contract instance.          |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usecontractwrite)       | Use this to get data from a contract read-function call.                   |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usecontractread)         | Use this to get a function to make a write call to your contract.          |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usecontractevents)     | Use this to get the contract metadata for a (built-in or custom) contract. |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usecontractmetadata) | Use this to get the contract metadata for a (built-in or custom) contract. |

### Wallet connection

| Hook                                                                             | Description                                                 |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------- |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.useaddress)               | Hook for accessing the address of the connected wallet.     |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usemetamask)             | Hook for connecting to a Metamask wallet.                   |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usewalletconnect)   | Hook for connecting to a mobile wallet with Wallet Connect. |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usecoinbasewallet) | Hook for connecting to a Coinbase wallet.                   |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usemagic)                   | Hook for connecting to an email wallet using magic link.    |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usegnosis)                 | Hook for connecting to a Gnosis Safe.                       |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usechainid)                 | Hook for accessing the chain ID of the network the current wallet is connected to                                                            |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usenetwork)                 | Hook for getting metadata about the network the current wallet is connected to and switching networks.                                       |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usenetworkmismatch) | Hook for checking whether the connected wallet is on the correct network specified by the desiredChainId passed to the <ThirdwebProvider />. |

### NFT

| Hook                                                                                             | Description                                                                         |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usenft)                                       | Use this to get an individual NFT token of your NFTContract.                        |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usenfts)                                     | Use this to get a list of NFT tokens of your NFTContract.                           |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usetotalcirculatingsupply) | Use this to get a the total (minted) supply of your NFTContract.                    |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.useownednfts)                           | Use this to get a the owned NFTs for a specific Erc721OrErc1155 and wallet address. |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usenftbalance)                         | Use this to get a the total balance of a NFTContract and wallet address.            |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usetotalcount)                         | Use this to get the total count of NFT tokens of your NFTContract.                  |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usemintnft)                               | Use this to mint a new NFT on your Erc721OrErc1155.                                 |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usemintnftsupply)                   | Use this mint extra supply on your Erc1155.                                         |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usetransfernft)                       | Use this to transfer tokens on your NFTContract.                                    |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.useairdropnft)                         | Use this to airdrop tokens on your Erc1155.                                         |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usetokensupply)               | Use this to get a the total supply of your contract.               |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usetokenbalance)             | Use this to get the balance of your contract for a given address.  |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usetokendecimals)           | Use this to get the decimals of your contract for a given address. |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.useminttoken)                   | Use this to mint new tokens on your contract.                      |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.useclaimtoken)                 | Use this to claim tokens from your contract.                       |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usetransfertoken)           | Use this to transfer tokens on your contract.                      |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usetransferbatchtoken) | Use this to transfer batch tokens on your contract.                |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.uselisting)                           | Use this to get a specific listing from the marketplace.                                  |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.uselistings)                         | Use this to get a list all listings from your marketplace contract.                       |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.uselistingscount)               | Use this to get a count of all listings on your marketplace contract.                     |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.useactivelistings)             | Use this to get a list active listings from your marketplace contract.                    |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usewinningbid)                     | Use this to get a the winning bid for an auction listing from your marketplace contract.  |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.useauctionwinner)               | Use this to get the winner of an auction listing from your marketplace contract.          |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usebidbuffer)                       | Use this to get the buffer in basis points between offers from your marketplace contract. |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usecreatedirectlisting)   | Use this to create a new Direct Listing on your marketplace contract.                     |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usecreateauctionlisting) | Use this to create a new Auction Listing on your marketplace contract.                    |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usecancellisting)               | Use this to cancel a listing on your marketplace contract.                                |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usemakebid)                           | Use this to place a bid on an auction listing from your marketplace contract.             |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usebuynow)                             | Use this to buy out an auction listing from your marketplace contract.                    |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.useBuyDirectListing)         | Use this to buy from a direct listing in your marketplace v3 contract.                    |

### Permissions Controls

| Hook                                                                                   | Description                                                                     |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.useallrolemembers)       | Use this to get the roles of all members.                                       |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.userolemembers)             | Use this to get the members of a role.                                          |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.useisaddressrole)         | Use this to check if a WalletAddress is a member of a role.                     |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usesetallrolemembers) | Use this to OVERWRITE the list of addresses that are members of specific roles. |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usegrantrole)                 | Use this to grant a WalletAddress a specific role.                              |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.useunclaimednfts)                 | Use this to get a list of unclaimed NFT tokens of your ERC721 Drop contract.         |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.useclaimednfts)                     | Use this to get a list of claimed (minted) NFT tokens of your ERC721 Drop contract.. |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.useunclaimednftsupply)       | Use this to get the total unclaimed NFT supply of your ERC721 Drop contract.         |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.useclaimednftsupply)           | Use this to get the total claimed (minted) NFT supply of your ERC721 Drop contract.  |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usebatchestoreveal)             | Use this to get a list of batches that are ready to be revealed.                     |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.useclaimnft)                           | Use this to claim a NFT on your DropContract                                         |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.uselazymint)                           | Use this to lazy mint a batch of NFTs on your DropContract.                          |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usedelayedreveallazymint) | Use this to lazy mint a batch of delayed reveal NFTs on your DropContract.           |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.useactiveclaimcondition)           | Use this to get the active claim condition for ERC20, ERC721 or ERC1155 based contracts.                 |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.useclaimconditions)                     | Use this to get all claim conditions for ERC20, ERC721 or ERC1155 based contracts.                       |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.useclaimineligibilityreasons) | Use this to check for reasons that prevent claiming for either ERC20, ERC721 or ERC1155 based contracts. |
| [

](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.usesetclaimconditions)               | Use this to set claim conditions on your DropContract.                                                   |
| [
](https://portal.thirdweb.com/react/react.useresetclaimconditions)           | Use this to reset claim conditions on your DropContract.                                                 |
